body_text:
This is based off of #902; 4bbf9df and onward are the commits you should care about. (Here's a convenient link to the commit range.)
When adding the remove buttons to about:studies, I realized that there was common logic around stopping studies that we wanted to share between the add-on and the action. So I refactored StudyStorage.jsm to have an API closer to PreferenceExperiments.jsm, with start and stop methods. It now handles the basic logic for installing and uninstalling add-on based studies.
This also adds an action implementation to the service that uses this API. I didn't bother with tests for the control interface changes, since it's being replaced. Once the new control interfaces merges we'll need to land admin UI for opt-out studies to it, or modify it if it already exists to support the argument changes.

title: Refactor StudyStorage.jsm to AddonStudies.jsm, add opt-out-study action
body:
This is based off of #902; 4bbf9df and onward are the commits you should care about. ([Here's a convenient link to the commit range](https://github.com/mozilla/normandy/pull/919/files/85b47b33ac9c0cd02aa8ce88bfbae7ec71482e9b..5f048a2a06a2f0d0ce516970802ba035eb24b48f).)

When adding the remove buttons to about:studies, I realized that there was common logic around stopping studies that we wanted to share between the add-on and the action. So I refactored `StudyStorage.jsm` to have an API closer to `PreferenceExperiments.jsm`, with start and stop methods. It now handles the basic logic for installing and uninstalling add-on based studies.

This also adds an action implementation to the service that uses this API. I didn't bother with tests for the control interface changes, since it's being replaced. Once the new control interfaces merges we'll need to land admin UI for opt-out studies to it, or modify it if it already exists to support the argument changes.
